body:
Kubernetes v1.1.2 and v1.1.4

I'm trying to use Auth0 in K8s Authentication.
And have come across this issue. 

apiserver.yaml

```
    - --oidc-issuer-url=https://sample.auth0.com
    - --oidc-client-id=CLIENT_SECRET_HERE
```

apiserver logs 

```
E0202 02:54:58.223319       1 oidc.go:99] Failed to fetch provider config, trying again in 3s: "issuer" in config (https://sample.auth0.com/) does not match provided issuer URL (https://sample.auth0.com)
```

it was able to check the openid configuration using the above url + /.well-known/openid-configuration in the k8s oidc codes

```
https://sample.auth0.com/.well-known/openid-configuration

and fails after comparing the retrieved  issuer from auth0 = "https://sample.auth0.com/"  and the defined issuer in the apiserver
```

Auth0 known configuration 

```
https://sample.auth0.com/.well-known/openid-configuration

{"issuer":"https://sample.auth0.com/","authorization_endpoint":"https://sample.auth0.com/authorize","token_endpoint":"https://sample.auth0.com/oauth/token","userinfo_endpoint":"https://sample.auth0.com/userinfo","jwks_uri":"https://sample.auth0.com/.well-known/jwks.json","scopes_supported":["openid","profile","offline_access","name","given_name","family_name","nickname","email","email_verified","picture","created_at","identities","phone","address"],"response_types_supported":["code","token","code token"],"response_modes_supported":["query","fragment","form_post"],"subject_types_supported":["public"],"id_token_signing_alg_values_supported":["HS256","RS256"],"token_endpoint_auth_methods_supported":["client_secret_basic","client_secret_post"],"claims_supported":["aud","auth_time","created_at","email","email_verified","exp","family_name","given_name","iat","identities","iss","name","nickname","phone_number","picture","sub"]}

```

Changing oidc-issuer-url to `https://sample.auth0.com/`will result to 

```
E0202 05:59:21.796520       1 oidc.go:99] Failed to fetch provider config, trying again in 3s: invalid character 'C' looking for beginning of value
```

Apparently, k8s is calling this link

```
https://sample.auth0.com//.well-known/openid-configuration

Cannot GET //.well-known/openid-configuration
```

labels.description: Must be staffed and worked on either currently, or very soon, ideally in time for the next release.
labels.name: priority/important-soon

title: Problem using Auth0 in Kubernetes OIDC Authentication
